conclusion: Principles of conservation of momentum and kinematics will be used to determine the exit velocity of the bullet.
The system (bullet + ball) moves horizontally with a common velocity v' after the bullet hits the ping-pong ball.
Initial momentum of the bullet is m v_b, and initial momentum of the ball is 0.
After the collision, the combined mass is m + M, and the common velocity is v'.
Using conservation of momentum, m v_b = (m + M) v', leading to v' = m v_b / (m + M).
The ball and bullet combination undergoes projectile motion after falling off the table.
The time t it takes to fall from height h is given by t = sqrt(2h/g).
The horizontal distance s is given by s = v' t, leading to s = v' sqrt(2h/g).
Substitute v' from the momentum equation into the projectile motion equation: s = (m v_b / (m + M)) sqrt(2h/g).
Solve for v_b: v_b = s (m + M) / m sqrt(g/2h).
The exit velocity of the bullet v_b is expressed in terms of the measured quantities s, h, m, M, and g.
